learningobjective: At the end of this challenge, the scholar will be able to perform the required task...

challenge.chatitle: Basic Usage of the Challenge-Based-Learning Sheets for STEMgraph
challenge.challenge_description: Challenges are a great way to learn new skills. They are designed to be self-explanatory and atomic, making them reusable and mix-and-matchable. Unlike lengthy tutorials, these challenges allow teachers to arrange multiple learning paths.\begin{figure}\centering\includegraphics[width=0.9\textwidth]{./assets/example.png}\caption{Screenshot of the STEMgraph node-network}\end{figure}
tasks: Write down a skill on a piece of paper that you really like.
Come up with a clear explanation of why this skill is useful in STEM.
Explain why this is a basic task to perform.
Think of 3 to 4 applications of this skill.

Write a request to ChatGPT using the following prompt:\\\begin{lstlisting}\\I am working on github.com/STEMgraph challenges.\\Today I worked on the following:<insert raw text of this challenge here>Please give me detailed feedback on my answers to the provided questions.Here are my answers in the correct order:<insert your answers to the task questions here>\\end{lstlisting}
questions: What is the skill you want to teach your scholars?
Why do you think it's a foundational skill?
What are the applications of this skill?
What prerequisites do you need to perform this skill?
What is the first step to perform this skill?
What advice do you have for the scholar at the end of this challenge?
challenge.advice: Let someone from your peer group try out your challenge. Have them open an issue on the GitHub repository and record the time it takes to complete the challenge. A good challenge should take less than 30 minutes to complete.
